clinical_study.brief_title: Meal Enjoyment and Tolerance: Sex Differences
clinical_study.official_title: Factors That Determine the Responses to Meal Ingestion: Sex Differences

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Aim: to determine the effect of gender on the responses to meal ingestion. Participants (10 men and 10 women) will be instructed to eat a standard dinner the day before, to consume a standard breakfast at home after overnight fast, and to report to the laboratory, where the test meal will be administered 4 h after breakfast. Studies will be conducted in a quiet, isolated room with participants sitting on a chair. Participants will ingest a probe meal up to the level of maximal satiation. The probe meal will be served stepwise (150 Kcal every 5 min). Perception of homeostatic (hunger/satiation, fullness) and hedonic (digestive well-being, mood) sensations will be measured at 5 min intervals 10 min before, during and 20 min after ingestion at 10 min intervals.

primary_outcome.description: Amount of meal (Kcal) consumed up to the level of maximal satiation (score 5 on a - 5 to + 5 score hunger/satiation scale).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in digestive well-being induced by the probe meal
secondary_outcome.description: Change in well-being measured by 10 score scales during and after the probe meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fullness sensation induced by the probe meal
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fullness sensation measured by 10 score scales during and after the probe meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mood induced by the probe meal
secondary_outcome.description: Change in mood measured by 10 score scales during and after the probe meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in abdominal discomfort induced by the probe meal
secondary_outcome.description: Change in abdominal discomfort measured by 10 score scales during and after the probe meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in hunger/satiety induced by the probe meal
secondary_outcome.description: Change in hunger/satiety measured by 10 score scales during and after the probe meal.

intervention.description: The probe meal will be served in 150 Kcal portions (10 g foie, 10 g cheese, 5 g chips, 2 g peanuts, 3 g toast, and 27 mL soft drink) up to the level of maximal satiation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- non-obese
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of gastrointestinal symptoms
- prior obesity
- use of medications
- history of anosmia and ageusia
- current dieting
- alcohol abuse
- psychological disorders
- eating disorders
